title: Substitute
text: First, substitute the given point into the equation. If the equality that results is true, then the point is a solution to the system.
speech: First, substitute the given point into the equation. If the equality that results is true, then the point is a solution to the system.
pacedSpeech: First, substitute the given point into the equation. If the equality that results is true, then the point is a solution to the system.

title: Substitute
text: When the point is substituted into the equation $$-2x+5y=7$$, do both sides equal each other?

subHints.title: Substitute
subHints.text: When the point is substituted into the equation $$2x+9y=7$$, do both sides equal each other?

speech: When the point is substituted into the equation  minus 2 x plus 5 y is equal to 7 , do both sides equal each other?
pacedSpeech: When the point is substituted into the equation   minus 2 x plus 5 y is equal to 7
, do both sides equal each other?

title: Interpret
text: Therefore, since the equation is equal on both sides for both equations, the point satisfies the system.
speech: Therefore, since the equation is equal on both sides for both equations, the point satisfies the system.
pacedSpeech: Therefore, since the equation is equal on both sides for both equations, the point satisfies the system.
